Others: 5% |- | [[Time zone]] || [[UTC]] +1 |- | valign=top | [[Airline]] carrier || - |} ==Ekonomy== ==Administration== *Deçan *Opojë *Gjakovë *Gllogovc *Gjilan *Burim *Kaçanik *Kamenicë *Klinë *Fushë Kosovë *Leposavic *Lipjan *Malishevë *Mitrovicë *Novobërdë *Kastriot *Rahovec *Pejë *Podujevë *Prishtinë *Prizren *Skenderaj *Strpce *Shtime *Suharekë *Ferizaj *Viti *Vushtrri *Zubin Potok *Zveçan *[[Preshevë]] *[[Bujanoc]] *[[Medvegjë]] ===Former official names=== * Autonomous Kosovo-Metohijan Area ([[1945]]-[[1963]]) * Autonomous Province of Kosovo and Metohija ([[1963]]-[[1968]]) * Socialist Autonomous Province of Kosovo ([[1968]]-[[1989]]) * Autonomous Province of Kosovo and Metohia ([[1989]] - present) * Kosovo was also called "republic of Kosovo" by the shadow Kosovo Albanian government between a [[1990]] declaration of independence and the Kosovo War in [[1999]]. == Currency == [[UNMIK]] declared the [[euro]] to be official currency of the republic in [[2001]] in the course of implementing a currency reform. This was undertaken to replace the previous widespread use of the [[Deutschmark]], which had become ''de facto'' currency even before the 1999 war. However, the [[Leku kosovar]] remains an official currency, though used principally by the [[Malishevë]]; it is only used sporadically outside of them. Most trade is conducted using the euro, Kosovo's administration uses euros exclusively, and all commercial banks use the euro as the primary currency. Of other international currencies, the [[United States dollar]] and [[Swiss franc]] are the most widespread. {{Republik of Kosova}} [[Category:History of Kosovo]]
